Process.

You might be wondering what comes after we sign a contract, so here's a rundown of my design process.

1Research.

The first step is research. For example, who are the competitors? If there is an existing solution? If so, how does it work?

2Ideation.

Ideas come next! Absolutely anything goes, the more ideas, the better. Even the bad ideas are worth something.

3Low-Fi.

This is the rapid prototyping stage. All the sketching, wireframing, and storyboarding happens here.

4Mockup.

When a series of wireframes are decided on, they will then be mocked up in Photoshop, Sketch, or Illustrator.

5Hi-Fi.

A high-fidelity prototype is created for testing. This is where majority of pre-build user-testing occurs. Depending on feedback, it might be time to step back a few steps and iterate.

6Build.

Development is underway, the design is mostly locked in at this point - there's not really any going back.

7Test.

I try as hard as I can to break the site and make sure to catch any bugs before the user does.

8Launch.

We have liftoff!

9Relax.

It's time to pour myself a drink, listen to some tunes, and wait for the users to flow in.

10Analyse.

The website is analysed and maintained. From the data gathered from real-world use, we can make changes to make the site do its job better.
